item.content:encoded: Want to build a business? You need an IT ecosystem. http://t.co/dodFygju #cloud #saas Just thirty years ago, innovation in almost any category was measured in years, but today it’s measured in weeks or months. item.title: [STUDY] Jonesing For A Retweet: Twitter Harder To Resist Than Cigarettes And Booze
item.description: [STUDY] Jonesing For A Retweet: Twitter Harder To Resist Than Cigarettes And Booze http://t.co/Hr7dHh6e
item.content:encoded: [STUDY] Jonesing For A Retweet: Twitter Harder To Resist Than Cigarettes And Booze http://t.co/Hr7dHh6e Sleep, sex and...Twitter? A new study suggests that people are more likely to give into the urge to check email and their Twitter account than they are to smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol. While the study headed by Wilhelm Hofmann of Chicago University's Booth Business School was limited in size, covering just 205 people between the ages of 18 and 85, it seems to confirm what many of us have suspected for years.... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: Startups pass on Silicon Valley to find their fortunes in New York — Tech News and Analysis
item.description: Startups pass on Silicon Valley to find their fortunes in New York http://t.co/yA6X30Do
item.content:encoded: Startups pass on Silicon Valley to find their fortunes in New York http://t.co/yA6X30Do Though Silicon Valley has lured away plenty of start-ups, (cough: Facebook), New York is becoming a magnet of its own, attracting companies that want to build their businesses amid the bright lights of the big city. In the last couple months, New York has drawn former San Francisco start-up Qwiki, PlaceIQ from Colorado and recent 500 Startups graduate Snapette, which started in Boston before spending the last half year in Silicon Valley. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gigaom.com
